title: What should I do if my course has been deleted?
excerpt: Ask your instructor if a new invitation link to the course materials will be
content:
Ask your instructor if a new invitation link to the course materials will be sent.

  • If a new invitation link to the course materials will be sent, wait for your instructor to send it to your class.
  • If a new invittion link to the course materials will not be sent and you already purchased an access code or online subscription for the deleted course, you can request a refund.

How can I get a refund?

Pearson offers full refunds for online purchases made only through Pearson. You must request a refund within 15 days of purchase.

Pearson 24/7 support cannot process refund requests. Select from the following purchase options to find out who to contact for your refund.

  • Revel website purchases

To request a refund for a purchase made at the Revel website, send a request to revelcs@custhelp.com with the following information:

  • First name
  • Last name
  • Email address used for registration
  • Reason for refund request

  • Pearson online subscription purchases (other than Revel)

To request a refund for an online subscription you purchased directly from a Pearson Education website, please send Customer Service (webaccesscs@pearson.com) an email that includes the following information:

  • First name
  • Last name
  • Email address used for registration
  • Reason for refund request

Refund request must be made within 15 days of purchase.

  • Third-party bookstore or website purchases

Contact the third-party bookstore or website for their refund policy and to request a refund.

What happens after I've requested my refund?

If you purchased the course from Pearson, you will receive two emails from webaccesscs@pearson.com letting you know the status of your refund request. To ensure that you receive these emails, add this account as a trusted address (or check your spam folder).
